title: WEB DEVELOPER FUNDAMENTALS
html:
HTML(HyperText Markup Language)
HTML define the meaning and the structure of the web content.

CSS(Cascading Style Sheets)
It's the standard for giving styles and interaction to information, to improve the user experience.

PROFILES OF A WEB DEVELOPER:

  1. FRONTEND
    The Frontend developer is the developer that will take care of things on the client side.
    The fundamentals technologies are:

    • HTML https://devdocs.io/html/

    • CSS https://devdocs.io/css/

    • JS https://devdocs.io/javascript/

      • CSS Frameworks
        A CSS framework is a generic style library that can be used to implement web designs.
        Some are:
        • Bootstrap.
        • Foundation CSS.
        • Materialize CSS.
          ⠀
      • Frameworks de JS
        A framework is "an abstraction in which the software that provides a generic functionality can be selectively changed by additional code written by the user". The frameworks are based in languages to accelerate processes and develop specific tools.
        Some of them are:
        • React JS.
        • Angular JS
        • Vue JS
          ⠀
      • CSS preprocessors
        A CSS preprocessor is a program that allows you to generate CSS from the unique sintax of the preprocessor. There are several CSS preprocessors to choose from, however most CSS preprocessors will add some features that do not exist in pure CSS, such as variable, mixins, nested selectors, among others. These features make the CSS structure more readable and easier to maintain.
        Some of them are:
        • LESS
        • STYLUS
        • SASS
          ⠀
      • JS Compilers / packagers
        • BABEL
        • Webpack

⠀
2. BACKEND
A backend developer is the opposite of what the frontend does, it works on the server side. It doesn't have a standard.

  • Programming Languages
    • NodeJS
    • Python
    • PHP
    • Go
    • Java
      ⠀
  • Frameworks
    • Django
    • Laravel
    • Express
    • Spring
      ⠀
  • Infrastructure.- Within this you can specialize as DevOps:
    • Google Cloud
    • Digital Ocean
    • AWS
    • Heroku
      ⠀
  • Databases
    • MongoDB
    • MySQL
    • PostgreSQL
      ⠀
  1. FULLSTACK
    A developer Fullstack is the fusion of a frontend developer and a backend developer in a single developer.
    A developer Fullstack is not a person who handles all technologies 100%, since these are constantly updated and must have an area of specialty.

STATIC PAGES vs. DINAMIC PAGES

  • Static pages or information pages.- All the pages that will have information to consume and the information won't change, these pages aren't connected to a database.

    • Blog Posts
    • Presentation of a brand

  • Dynamic pages or Web applications.- They are pages in which you can interact, they are connected to a database, the content change frequently.

    • Social networks
desc: A Web Developer has to know very important concepts, such as the profiles of a Web Developer, technologies, standards, types of pages, etc.
